vars:
  key_path: "/Users/quatton/Documents/GitHub/qwex/playground/opencode-eval/demo/.ssh/id_rsa"
  port: "2345"
  user: "testuser"
  host: "localhost"

tasks:
  ssh:
    desc: "Connect via SSH and run a command"
    cmd: |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }} {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }} "$@"

  run:
    desc: "Generate run ID, store metadata locally, and execute SSH command"
    cmd: |
      run_id="$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(uuidgen | cut -c1-8)"
      echo "RUN_ID=$run_id"
      
      # Local storage
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir/meta"
      
      # Reconstruct command string trying to preserve quotes if possible or just dump arguments
      # The assert checks: grep -q "echo 'Checking run details storage'" "$RUN_DIR/meta/command"
      # This implies the stored command must contain single quotes around the argument.
      # Bash eats the quotes before they get to us.
      # We can't recover the exact quoting used by the caller easily in bash script arguments.
      # However, we can try to quote arguments that have spaces.
      
      cmd_str=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        if [[ "$arg" == *" "* ]]; then
           cmd_str="$cmd_str '$arg'"
        else
           cmd_str="$cmd_str $arg"
        fi
      done
      # trim leading space
      echo "${cmd_str:1}" > "$local_run_dir/meta/command"

      {{ tasks.ssh }} "$@"

vars:
  key_path: "/Users/quatton/Documents/GitHub/qwex/playground/opencode-eval/demo/.ssh/id_rsa"
  port: "2345"
  user: "testuser"
  host: "localhost"

tasks:
  ssh:
    desc: "Connect via SSH and run a command"
    cmd: |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }} {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }} "$@"

  run:
    desc: "Generate run ID, store metadata, and execute SSH command with logging"
    cmd: |
      run_id="$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(uuidgen | cut -c1-8)"
      echo "RUN_ID=$run_id"
      
      # Local storage for command
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir/meta"
      cmd_str=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        if [[ "$arg" == *" "* ]]; then
           cmd_str="$cmd_str '$arg'"
        else
           cmd_str="$cmd_str $arg"
        fi
      done
      echo "${cmd_str:1}" > "$local_run_dir/meta/command"

      # Prepare remote command to save logs
      # We need to create the directory on remote and then run the command piping output to file and stdout
      # Using tee to write to file and stdout
      
      remote_run_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      remote_log_file="$remote_run_dir/logs/main.log"
      
      # We execute a complex command over SSH
      # 1. Create directory
      # 2. Execute command and pipe to tee
      
      # Using printf %q to safely quote arguments for the remote shell

      done

vars:
  key_path: "/Users/quatton/Documents/GitHub/qwex/playground/opencode-eval/demo/.ssh/id_rsa"
  port: "2345"
  user: "testuser"
  host: "localhost"

tasks:
  ssh:
    desc: "Connect via SSH and run a command"
    cmd: |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }} {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }} "$@"

  retrieve:
    desc: "Retrieve run artifacts from remote host"
    vars:
      run_id: ""
    cmd: |
      run_id="$1"
      if [ -z "$run_id" ]; then
        echo "Usage: retrieve <RUNID>"
        exit 1
      fi
      
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir"
      
      # Use rsync to copy files from remote to local
      rsync -av -e "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }}" \
        {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }}:.qwex/runs/$run_id/ "$local_run_dir/"

  run:
    desc: "Generate run ID, store metadata, and execute SSH command with logging"
    cmd: |
      run_id="$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(uuidgen | cut -c1-8)"
      echo "RUN_ID=$run_id"
      
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir/meta"
      cmd_str=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        if [[ "$arg" == *" "* ]]; then
           cmd_str="$cmd_str '$arg'"
        else
           cmd_str="$cmd_str $arg"
        fi
      done
      echo "${cmd_str:1}" > "$local_run_dir/meta/command"

      remote_run_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      remote_log_file="$remote_run_dir/logs/main.log"
      
      quoted_args=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        quoted_args="$quoted_args $(printf %q "$arg")"
      done

      {{ tasks.ssh }} "mkdir -p $remote_run_dir/logs && $quoted_args 2>&1 | tee $remote_log_file"

input.content:
vars:
  key_path: "/Users/quatton/Documents/GitHub/qwex/playground/opencode-eval/demo/.ssh/id_rsa"
  port: "2345"
  user: "testuser"
  host: "localhost"

tasks:
  ssh:
    desc: "Connect via SSH and run a command"
    cmd: |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }} {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }} "$@"

  retrieve:
    desc: "Retrieve run artifacts from remote host using scp since rsync is missing"
    vars:
      run_id: ""
    cmd: |
      run_id="$1"
      if [ -z "$run_id" ]; then
        echo "Usage: retrieve <RUNID>"
        exit 1
      fi
      
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir"
      
      # Use scp instead of rsync because rsync is not available remotely
      scp -r -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -P {{ vars.port }} \
        {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }}:.qwex/runs/$run_id/* "$local_run_dir/"

  run:
    desc: "Execute command in a remote git worktree with environment setup"
    cmd: |
      # Ensure local repo is clean
      if [[ -n $(git status --porcelain) ]]; then
        echo "Error: Git repository is not clean. Please commit or stash changes."
        exit 1
      fi

      run_id="$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(uuidgen | cut -c1-8)"
      echo "RUN_ID=$run_id"
      
      # Local storage
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir/meta"
      cmd_str=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        if [[ "$arg" == *" "* ]]; then
           cmd_str="$cmd_str '$arg'"
        else
           cmd_str="$cmd_str $arg"
        fi
      done
      echo "${cmd_str:1}" > "$local_run_dir/meta/command"

      # Get current commit hash and repo name
      current_commit=$(git rev-parse HEAD)
      repo_name=$(basename $(git rev-parse --show-toplevel))
      
      remote_repo_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/repos/$repo_name.git"
      remote_worktree_dir="$remote_repo_dir/worktree/$run_id"
      remote_run_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      remote_log_file="$remote_run_dir/logs/main.log"

      # Sync repo to remote
      # We use tar to send the .git directory to the remote
      # Creating the remote bare repo/dir if it doesn't exist is handled
      
      # Prepare remote structure
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "mkdir -p $remote_repo_dir $remote_run_dir/logs"
      
      # Push changes to remote repo.
      # If remote repo doesn't exist as a git repo, we initialize it.
      # But rsyncing the local .git is easier if rsync existed.
      # Since rsync is missing, we use tar over ssh to sync .git
      # Warning: this overwrites the remote .git
      
      tar cf - .git | {{ tasks.ssh }} "tar xf - -C $remote_repo_dir"
      
      # Create worktree on remote
      # We need to make sure we are inside the remote repo dir to run git commands
      # and force checkout of the specific commit
      
      setup_script="
      cd $remote_repo_dir
      # Ensure it's treated as a working repo or just use it to checkout
      # If we just copied .git to $remote_repo_dir, then $remote_repo_dir IS the repo root (but without files initially)
      # Actually, we copied .git folder INTO $remote_repo_dir. So $remote_repo_dir/.git exists.
      
      # Let's fix the pathing. local .git -> remote $remote_repo_dir/.git
      
      # Checkout the worktree
      git --git-dir=.git --work-tree=. worktree add --detach $remote_worktree_dir $current_commit
      
      cd $remote_worktree_dir
      
      # Install uv if needed
      if ! command -v uv &> /dev/null; then
          curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
          source \$HOME/.cargo/env
      fi
      
      # Run uv sync
      uv sync
      "
      
      # Run the setup script
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "$setup_script"

      # Execute the command in the worktree
      quoted_args=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        quoted_args="$quoted_args $(printf %q "$arg")"
      done
      
      # We need to source cargo env again just in case it was just installed in a subshell
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "cd $remote_worktree_dir && source \$HOME/.cargo/env && $quoted_args 2>&1 | tee $remote_log_file"

input.content:
vars:
  key_path: "/Users/quatton/Documents/GitHub/qwex/playground/opencode-eval/demo/.ssh/id_rsa"
  port: "2345"
  user: "testuser"
  host: "localhost"

tasks:
  ssh:
    desc: "Connect via SSH and run a command"
    cmd: |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }} {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }} "$@"

  retrieve:
    desc: "Retrieve run artifacts from remote host using scp since rsync is missing"
    vars:
      run_id: ""
    cmd: |
      run_id="$1"
      if [ -z "$run_id" ]; then
        echo "Usage: retrieve <RUNID>"
        exit 1
      fi
      
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir"
      
      # Use scp instead of rsync because rsync is not available remotely
      scp -r -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -P {{ vars.port }} \
        {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }}:.qwex/runs/$run_id/* "$local_run_dir/"

  run:
    desc: "Execute command in a remote git worktree with environment setup"
    cmd: |
      # Ensure local repo is clean
      if [[ -n $(git status --porcelain) ]]; then
        echo "Error: Git repository is not clean. Please commit or stash changes."
        exit 1
      fi

      run_id="$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(uuidgen | cut -c1-8)"
      echo "RUN_ID=$run_id"
      
      # Local storage
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir/meta"
      cmd_str=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        if [[ "$arg" == *" "* ]]; then
           cmd_str="$cmd_str '$arg'"
        else
           cmd_str="$cmd_str $arg"
        fi
      done
      echo "${cmd_str:1}" > "$local_run_dir/meta/command"

      # Get current commit hash and repo name
      current_commit=$(git rev-parse HEAD)
      repo_name=$(basename $(git rev-parse --show-toplevel))
      
      remote_repo_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/repos/$repo_name.git"
      remote_worktree_dir="$remote_repo_dir/worktree/$run_id"
      remote_run_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      remote_log_file="$remote_run_dir/logs/main.log"

      # Sync repo to remote
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "mkdir -p $remote_repo_dir $remote_run_dir/logs"
      
      # Suppress tar warnings about extended headers
      COPYFILE_DISABLE=1 tar cf - .git | {{ tasks.ssh }} "tar xf - -C $remote_repo_dir"
      
      setup_script="
      cd $remote_repo_dir
      git --git-dir=.git --work-tree=. worktree add --detach $remote_worktree_dir $current_commit
      
      cd $remote_worktree_dir
      
      # Install uv if needed
      if ! command -v uv &> /dev/null; then
          curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
      fi
      "
      
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "$setup_script"

      quoted_args=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        quoted_args="$quoted_args $(printf %q "$arg")"
      done
      
      # Source cargo env if it exists, otherwise assume uv is in path or just installed
      # Also run uv sync
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "cd $remote_worktree_dir && [ -f \$HOME/.cargo/env ] && source \$HOME/.cargo/env; uv sync && $quoted_args 2>&1 | tee $remote_log_file"

parts.text:
The mission is complete! All steps in the `qwex` test suite have passed successfully.

Here is a summary of the final `ssh_gen.yaml` configuration that satisfied all requirements, including the complex remote execution logic with `git worktree` and `uv` environment setup:

```yaml
vars:
  key_path: "/Users/quatton/Documents/GitHub/qwex/playground/opencode-eval/demo/.ssh/id_rsa"
  port: "2345"
  user: "testuser"
  host: "localhost"

tasks:
  ssh:
    desc: "Connect via SSH and run a command"
    cmd: |
      ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -p {{ vars.port }} {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }} "$@"

  retrieve:
    desc: "Retrieve run artifacts from remote host using scp since rsync is missing"
    vars:
      run_id: ""
    cmd: |
      run_id="$1"
      if [ -z "$run_id" ]; then
        echo "Usage: retrieve <RUNID>"
        exit 1
      fi
      
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir"
      
      # Use scp instead of rsync because rsync is not available remotely
      scp -r -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -i {{ vars.key_path }} -P {{ vars.port }} \
        {{ vars.user }}@{{ vars.host }}:.qwex/runs/$run_id/* "$local_run_dir/"

  run:
    desc: "Execute command in a remote git worktree with environment setup"
    cmd: |
      # Ensure local repo is clean
      if [[ -n $(git status --porcelain) ]]; then
        echo "Error: Git repository is not clean. Please commit or stash changes."
        exit 1
      fi

      run_id="$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(uuidgen | cut -c1-8)"
      echo "RUN_ID=$run_id"
      
      # Local storage
      local_run_dir="$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      mkdir -p "$local_run_dir/meta"
      cmd_str=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        if [[ "$arg" == *" "* ]]; then
           cmd_str="$cmd_str '$arg'"
        else
           cmd_str="$cmd_str $arg"
        fi
      done
      echo "${cmd_str:1}" > "$local_run_dir/meta/command"

      # Get current commit hash and repo name
      current_commit=$(git rev-parse HEAD)
      repo_name=$(basename $(git rev-parse --show-toplevel))
      
      remote_repo_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/repos/$repo_name.git"
      remote_worktree_dir="$remote_repo_dir/worktree/$run_id"
      remote_run_dir="\$HOME/.qwex/runs/$run_id"
      remote_log_file="$remote_run_dir/logs/main.log"

      # Sync repo to remote
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "mkdir -p $remote_repo_dir $remote_run_dir/logs"
      
      # Suppress tar warnings about extended headers
      COPYFILE_DISABLE=1 tar cf - .git | {{ tasks.ssh }} "tar xf - -C $remote_repo_dir"
      
      setup_script="
      cd $remote_repo_dir
      git --git-dir=.git --work-tree=. worktree add --detach $remote_worktree_dir $current_commit
      
      cd $remote_worktree_dir
      
      # Install uv if needed
      if ! command -v uv &> /dev/null; then
          curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
      fi
      "
      
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "$setup_script"

      quoted_args=""
      for arg in "$@"; do
        quoted_args="$quoted_args $(printf %q "$arg")"
      done
      
      # Source cargo env if it exists, otherwise assume uv is in path or just installed
      # Also run uv sync
      {{ tasks.ssh }} "cd $remote_worktree_dir && [ -f \$HOME/.cargo/env ] && source \$HOME/.cargo/env; uv sync && $quoted_args 2>&1 | tee $remote_log_file"
```
